snippet: The recall covers 10 countries and represents a blow to the South Korean company’s effort to catch up with the Apple iPhone....
abstract: Samsung announces it is recalling Galaxy Note 7 smartphone because flaw in lithium-ion batteries may cause device to burst into flames; recall damages company's reputation and will probably decrease third quarter profits.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and SU-HYUN LEE
byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong and Su-Hyun Lee from Seoul, South Korea. Mark Scott contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The recall covers 10 countries and represents a blow to the South Korean company’s effort to catch up with the Apple iPhone.

headline.main: Samsung to Recall 2.5 Million Galaxy Note 7s Over Battery Fires
headline.print_headline: Samsung Recalls Phone  Over Risk of Battery Fire
